cyclone.name: HAROLD
cyclone.current_location: about 480 mi ESE of Port Mansfield, Texas
cyclone.trajectory: tracking quickly westward toward the south-central Texas coast with landfall expected early Tuesday, then moving inland into northern Mexico
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: south Texas coast near Port Mansfield–Baffin Bay

weather_observation.warning_coast: Mouth of Rio Grande to Port O'Connor, Texas
weather_observation.impacted_coast: South and middle Texas coast from the Rio Grande northward through Matagorda Bay
weather_observation.wind: Brief tropical-storm-force gusts possible Tuesday (probability only 6%; sustained winds likely below 39 mph).
weather_observation.storm_surge: Water levels could rise 1–3 ft above ground Tuesday, especially around high tide.
weather_observation.rainfall: 1–3 inches of rain possible Tuesday, locally higher in bands.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Rough seas and dangerous rip currents beginning late Monday night and persisting through Tuesday.
